result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier K Eveland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Jackson County Case No. 15CF61.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain full time employment approved by his agent.  Not to terminate his employment without his agent's prior approval.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person,or by any other means with L.P.L. (DOB:  10/21/1999), her family or their residences.  Comply with all no contact orders of his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

AMENDED 11/13/17.  Comply with Wis. Stat. 301.45(5)(a)(2) for a period of 15 years after discharge from parole, extended supervision, community supervision, or aftercare supervision.

Obtain housing approved by his agent.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorneys Gardner and Krische.  All parties have the revocation packet.  No corrections or changed noted by any party.  State recommended:  In 14CF13-  11 years total.  6 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision.  In 16CF192.   Count 1- 2 years total.   1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision.   Count 3-  6 years total.  3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.   In 16CF193.  7 years total.   3 years initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision.  In 16CF205.   6 years total. 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.  All consecutive, and consecutive to any sentence now serving.  Not eligible for SAP or CIP.   Attorney Krische recommended.  16CF192.  Count 1.  9 months or 1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision.  Count 3.  3 years total.   1 year initial confinement and  2 years extended supervision.  In 16CF193.  2-3 years initial confinement and 3-4 years extended supervision.  16CF205.  1 year initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  All concurrent and concurrent to sentence now serving.  Eligible for SAP and CIP.  Attorney Gardner recommended in 14CF13- 6 years total.  2 years initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision.  

Court ordered: 

In 14CF13.  10  years total.   5 years initial confinement, 5 years extended supervision.  Concurrent with 16CF192.  Consecutive to 15CF61 (sentence now serving)  Not eligible for SAP and CIP.  

In 16CF192.   Count 1-  2 years total.   1 year initial confinement and 1 year extended supervision.   Count 3-  4 years total.  2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision.  Concurrent with 14CF13.  Consecutive to 15CF61 (sentence now serving)  Not eligible for SAP and CIP.  

In 16CF193.   7 years total. 3  years initial confinement and 4 years extended supervision.  Consecutive to 14CF13, 16CF192 and 15CF61. Not eligible for SAP and CIP.  

In 16CF205.   6 years total.  3 years initial confinement and 3  years extended supervision.  Consecutive to 14CF13, 15CF192, 16CF193 and 15CF61.  Eligible for SAP and CIP.  

Extended supervision conditions:  No contact with the victim LPL (dob:  10/21/99),  her family or their residences.   Comply with all no contact orders of his agent.  Life time registry as a sex offender and be in full compliance with the sex offender registry statute.  AODA and recommended treatment and counseling.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.     Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  Random testing for drug/alcohol.  Obtain and maintain full time employment approved by his agent.  Not to terminate without his agent's prior approval.  Obtain housing approved by his agent.  CC.  Any sentence credit to be determined by stipulation and presented to the court.     The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Document: Proposed Order - Writ - SEH - 04-12-17; _2 - Eveland, Xavier K.docx Filed by: District Attorney Reason: this is assigned to Judge Goodman
Sentencing hearing April 12, 2017 at 10:00 a.m.

Defendant appears in person, in custody with both counsel, Robert Gardner and Matthew Krische.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Gardner represents on:  13CM406, 14CM204, 14CM85, 14CF13, 13CM310, 15CF180.  Attorney Krische represents on:  16CF205, 16CF193, 16CF194, 16CF192.  State has complied with victim notification.  Reading of 2nd amended information in 14CF13 is waived.  Judge cites the charge and potential penalties.  Will plea also to amended Ct 1 & Ct 3 - 16CF192, 16CF205 - Ct 3, 16CF193 - Ct 1.   Court reviewed all charges and potential penalties.  He understands.  Defendant pleads:  14CF13, Ct 3 - No Contest;  16CF192, Ct 1 - No Contest & Ct 3 - No Contest; 16CF193, Ct 1 - No Contest, 16CF205, Ct 3 - No Contest.  Attorney Gardner states the questionnaire needs to corrected and states he explained the difference to the defendant and he understands it.  Attorney Krische states he has discussed with his client and believes he understands.  Plea colloquy performed with defendant and felony warning given.  There are no restitution issues per ADA Inlow.  A PSI will be ordered.  Recommended sentencing stated by the Court and some discussion regarding such by counsel and ADA Inlow.  Court reviews elements of all 5 charges being plead to today.  Court performs colloquy with defendant regarding his waiver of rights.  Attorney Krische stipulates to the facts in the complaints to support pleas.  Attorney Gardner does as well in 14CF13.  Defendant confirms 3 prior convictions for misdemeanor bail jumping.  Court finds the defendant has entered his pleas and there are freely, voluntarily, and intelligently made; he understands the rights he's waiving and freely and voluntarily waives that right; finds a factual basis exists for each charge.  Court accepts his pleas and finds him guilty of those charges as plead to.  All other remaining counts/cases are dismissed and read-in along with 15CF180 (Judge Becker's case) is dismissed and read-in.  PSI ordered and is due within 45 days, sentencing to be set.

Does not require a conviction.  Parties referenced 969.13 Wis. Stat.  Court ordered the $10,000.00 bond forfeited.  Attorney Gardner will pursue perfection of the substitution from Attorney Martinez.  New cash bond set.

INCORRECT CASE NUMBERS AND CONDITIONS LISTED BY JASO.  Covers the following Jackson County Case No. 13CM310, 13CM406,14CF13,14CM85, 11CF68, 12CF110, 12CF114, 14CM204.    Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  M.C., LPL (DOB: 10/21/1999) or any females under the age of 18.    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Comply with all treatment court rules, including testing requirements.

Defense counsels Erika Bahnson & Jon Sherman present.  Defendant failed to appear.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Sherman represents defendant on 13CM310 & 14CM406.  Attorney Bahnson has the remaining cases.  Attorney Sherman states he has had no contact with his client.  Attorney Bahnson states she talked to him last Thursday and she doesn't know where he is.  Court authorizes a warrant on all cases except 11CF68 as that case is already in warrant status.

Defendant and his counsel Erika Bahnson appeared by phone.  No appearance by attorney Jon Sherman.  Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Judge Goodman was by phone from Monroe County.  Attorney Bahnson states she was recently appointed by the SPD on several more of defendant's cases and has not had a significant conversation as of this time.  Court set another status for 5-26-15 at 9:00 a.m.  Attorney Erika Bahnson represents defendant on the following cases:  11CF68, 12CF110, 12CF114, 14CM85, 14CM204, 14CF13 and Attorney Jon Sherman represents him on 13CM310 and 13CM406.

Defendant appeared with counsel Erica Bahnson in 14CM85 & 14CF13; and counsel Jon Sherman on 13CM406 & 13CM310; and he is not represented by counsel on 12CF114, 12CF110, 11CF68, and 14CM204.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  DA Fox states since there is no longer Treatment Court that is a new factor and he can be re-sentenced on 12CF114, 12CF110, and 11CF68.  Court states the defendant needs to contact SPD for appointment on the 4 non-represented cases.  For now attorney Sherman will remain on his cases.  Attorney Bahnson is to contact the JA for scheduling.
allowing withdrawal of counsel.
